references.paper_title: Advances and open problems in federated learning
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of federated learning, addressing key challenges and outlining future research directions, making it a foundational work in the field.

references.paper_title: Communication-efficient learning of deep networks from decentralized data
references.reason: This influential paper introduced the FedAvg algorithm, a cornerstone of federated learning, and its communication-efficient approach to training deep networks across decentralized data.
This work addresses the challenges of federated learning in heterogeneous networks, offering valuable insights into algorithm design and convergence analysis for diverse client data distributions.

references.paper_title: Fast federated learning in the presence of arbitrary device unavailability
references.reason: This paper directly tackles the problem of intermittent client availability, a key challenge in real-world federated learning deployments, proposing techniques to improve robustness and efficiency.

references.paper_title: Federated learning under intermittent client availability and time-varying communication constraints
references.reason: This paper focuses on the impact of time-varying client availability and communication constraints on federated learning, providing insights into algorithm design under dynamic conditions.
